Package ausroulette.model.bet

Interface Bet

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ColorBet, NumberBet, SplitBet
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColorBetImpl, NumberBetImpl, SplitBetImpl
    public interface Bet
    Represents a bet in the Aussie Roulette game in the Further Programming Assignment.

    You must not alter this interface.

    This interface is extended by

    • ColorBet
    • NumberBet
    • SplitBet.

    You're encouraged to think about the common functionality that exists between them.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    BetType, ColorBet, NumberBet, SplitBet, Comparable

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        the player who placed this bet

      • getAmount

        int getAmount()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        the amount bet

      • getBetType

        BetType getBetType()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        the BetType for the bet

      • getWinningPocket

        Pocket getWinningPocket()
        A simple getter
        Returns:
        the winning pocket for finalised bet, or null if not finalised

      • finaliseBet

        int finaliseBet​(Pocket winningPocket)
        Called when finalising a bet.

        This methods should be used change the state of a bet from being placed (outcome unknown) to being either a win or loss. This state should be able to be retrieved after the bet has been finalised (which would usually occur at the end of a spin).

        Parameters:
        winningPocket - the winning (final) wheel pocket at the conclusion of a spin
        Returns:
        the amount won by the bet, or zero if result was a loss.
        See Also:
        Player.acceptBet(Bet), Player.applyBetOutcome(Bet), GameEngine.applyWinLoss(int, Pocket)

      • isWin

        boolean isWin()
        Indicates if a finalised bet resulted in a win or not.
        Returns:
        true if the bet is finalised and the bet won, otherwise false

      • getAmountWon

        int getAmountWon()
        Returns the amount won from a finalised bet. This will be zero if the bet resulted in a loss or the bet is not yet finalised.
        Returns:
        the amount won or 0 if a bet was a loss or is not yet finalised

      • equals

        boolean equals​(Bet bet)
        Compares two bets to determine if they're equal.

        Equality should be based on all relevant information of the bets; player, amount, bet type as well as the data type of the Bet object itself and properties relevant to each sub-class.

        Parameters:
        bet - to be used for comparison
        Returns:
        true is all the properties of the two bets are equal

      • equals

        boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the Object to be used for comparison
        Returns:
        true if supplied Object is a Bet and the two bets are equal, otherwise false

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code value for this bet based on all relevant properties

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a String representation of the Bet as seen in the supplied .log file.

        The String must match exactly the expected String. This will be tested during marking.

        Examples: 

         P1 bet 12 on Black
 P2 bet 6 on Zero
 P2 bet 3 on Number #11
 P1 bet 3 on 2-way Split [1, 2]
 P1 bet 4 on 4-way Split [28, 29, 31, 32]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the Bet
